Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from five fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior: reserved band around rim, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black band around top of offset rim; below, incised lotus and palmette chain with added red on heart and alternating petals of palmettes and faded added white on central leaf of lotus; below on body, black-figure decoration consisting of nude bearded male figure (right arm and lower legs missing; with red on hair, beard and chest) dancing, to left and possibly holding a phiale.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Zurich, University Coll. 3844 in Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups III. Amsterdam 2000, pl. 176, no. 495. The sherd is also referred to in Beazley's Archive, vase number 15163. The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.760 and 1886,0401.1056.d.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 260, no. 23)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 376, no. B520)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (pl. 182, no. 513a)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 229, no. 1b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0393) (Phase 1)
